abstract: Former American soccer official Chuck Blazer, who plead guilty in 2013 to 10-count charge as part of wide-ranging investigation into rampant corruption in international soccer, faces maximum penalty of 15 years in prison; apparently became cooperating witness and helped investigators indict 13 other FIFA soccer and marketing officials.
lead_paragraph: A long-time soccer power broker had an enormous appetite for expensive meals, luxury travel, and, according to federal authorities, corrupt self-enrichment.

headline.main: Chuck Blazer, a Soccer Bon Vivant Laid Low
headline.print_headline: A Bon Vivant Pleads Guilty and Apparently Cooperates

snippet: A long-time soccer power broker had an enormous appetite for expensive meals, luxury travel, and, according to federal authorities, corrupt self-enrichment.

keywords.value: Confederation of North, Central American and Caribbean Association Football (CONCACAF)
keywords.name: organizations
